ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: My Japanese got a lot stronger, and I feel much more confident about using both formal and informal speech. Yamaguchi Sensei does a good job of incorporating presentations and follow-up questions in class, so I got a lot of experience using Japanese spontaneously and as a result, I feel like I am a much better and more confident speaker.
How to speak, listen, read, and write Japanese.
I learned a lot more about Japanese grammar and culture
Intermediate level grammar, speaking, reading and writing in Japanese. Cultural knowledge of Japan

I learned additional Japanese vocabulary/sentence structures/kanji/Japanese culture, and more. There were plenty of Japanese passages we read over and practiced, as well as opportunities to speak and present during class.
Learned how to read new kanji characters, advanced grammar, and become more proficient at speaking Japanese.
Japanese culture, improved japanese speaking and reading abilities

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: the homework helped me learn, class was always a really helpful and friendly environment, and Yamaguchi Sensei was really supportive! I felt like I was improving every class.
Weaknesses: none that I can think of
This course is perfect as it is.

Yamaguchi Sensei is wonderful and a very effective teacher. I really enjoyed the course.

Weakness: however, something really minor that could make the course better is if assignments were posted in the assignment tab so that we could see the assignment in our to-do.

Enjoyed the class discussion style. Could be improved by not discussing HW assignments in class and touching on other topics instead. Liked the skits and presentations format but maybe there were too many

This course focused on putting Japanese into practice in speaking, writing, and reading. The course placed an emphasis on practicing speaking Japanese through various presentations and speaking sessions during class. We were also taught about Japanese culture, all of which were strengths. One of the weaknesses of this course was the expectation that every student would be on the same level of language learning in terms of speaking the language and reading. This was not conducive to a learning environment.

The course requires a variety of daily coursework (voice memos, grammar worksheets, etc.) so it helps you reinforce your previous knowledge of Japanese in your every day and challenges you to use newly learned knowledge.
NA

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Definitely! I think your Japanese gets a lot stronger, and the class itself is really fun. Even though it was every day, it never felt like drag and I felt like I gained something valuable out of every class.
Yes, I would!
Yep! If youve taken L3 this course is a very natural step up!
Yes, worth continuing beyond L3 even if you don't require it for a language credit. It's a fair amount of work but you will improve your Japanese quite a bit
Yes! I could feel that all aspects of my Japanese improved tremendously in this course.

I would recommend this course to another student due to the great organization of the class and the amount of Japanese that one gets to practice on the daily. The only caution I have is to keep in mind this class will take around 3 hours everyday for completion of assignments and review.

Yes I would recommend this course to any student looking to advance their Japanese level after L3. The class meets daily so it is a commitment but it is worth it if you are dedicated to learning Japanese.
For those interested in learning Japanese, this is a great way to improve
